summary: This bill, the "Nurse Staffing Standards for Hospital Patient Safety and Quality Care Act of 2025," aims to amend the Public Health Service Act. It mandates minimum direct care registered nurse-to-patient staffing ratios in hospitals, with varying ratios based on unit type. The bill outlines staffing plan requirements, including considerations for factors like patient acuity and hospital transparency. It includes provisions for enforcement, whistleblower protections, and adjusts Medicare/Medicaid and other federal programs to ensure compliance. The bill also includes a nurse workforce initiative to support nurse retention and training through scholarships, stipends and nurse retention grants.
